meanings.definition: The act or process of relaxing.
meanings.sent1: After a long day, she found solace in the relaxations of a warm bath.
meanings.sent2: His favorite part of the day was the relaxations he enjoyed while listening to music.
meanings.sent3: The cat's purring brought a sense of relaxations to the entire room.
meanings.sent4: The relaxations of the gentle waves on the shore lulled him into a peaceful sleep.
meanings.sent5: The relaxations of a good book can transport you to another world.

meanings.sent1: The hammock swayed gently, creating an atmosphere of relaxations in the backyard.
meanings.sent2: She basked in the relaxations of a lazy Sunday afternoon.
meanings.sent3: The dog's contented sigh indicated a state of pure relaxations.
meanings.sent4: The relaxations of a carefree mindset allowed her to enjoy the moment.
meanings.sent5: The relaxations of a peaceful mind are priceless in today's fast-paced world.

meanings.definition: A temporary release from tension or stress.
meanings.sent1: The deep breaths provided moments of relaxations during the hectic day.
meanings.sent2: Yoga offers a path to find relaxations amidst the chaos of life.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's jokes brought much-needed relaxations to the audience.
meanings.sent4: The laughter shared among friends was a beautiful relaxations from daily worries.
meanings.sent5: In the embrace of nature, one can find relaxations from the demands of society.
